headline: Tariff odds, TSMC's foundry goals, new Intel CEO: Top Chip Stories
summary: Investors weigh the US position in the AI chip landscape after President Donald Trump took aim at the CHIPS & Science Act, a Biden-era policy that invested billions into the sector and domestic semiconductor manufacturing. Tufts University international history professor at the Fletcher School Christopher Miller examines the future of the CHIPS Act, as well as other top themes and stories in the chip space, like Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company's (TSM) reported talks to run Intel's foundry business (INTC), Intel's new CEO, and more. Miller is also the author of Chip War: The Fight for the World’s Most Critical Technology. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination here.

headline: Broadcom Chairman Henry Samueli Plans to Sell Up to $500 Million of Stock
summary: Chairman Henry Samueli adopted a plan to sell $500 million of stock, and to donate stock to a philanthropy he and his wife Susan co-founded.

headline: Broadcom's AI Growth Is Unstoppable. Is the Dividend-Paying Growth Stock a Buy Now?
summary: Shares of Broadcom (NASDAQ: AVGO) are up more than 780% in the last five years, pole-vaulting its market cap to over $900 billion.  Here's why Broadcom's innovation is kicking into a higher gear, and why this growth stock is a buy now.  Diversification is the single most compelling reason to invest in Broadcom over other semiconductor stocks.

headline: Intel’s incoming Malaysian-born CEO is the latest Fortune 500 semiconductor exec to hail from Asia
summary: Lip-Bu Tan, who was born in Malaysia and went to university in Singapore, will take over as Intel's CEO on March 18. The news sent shares up over 10%.

headline: Stocks Tiptoe Higher, But Tariff Tensions Loom
summary: After dipping its toes into correction waters, the S&P 500 found a reason to smile: oversold conditions. What sparked the glimmer of optimism was a milder inflation reading.
